scenarioDescription:
The HD 46375 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 46375 is a star with 0.92 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 96.39 light years away from the solar system.

HD 46375 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 46375 system


HD 46375 b

HD 46375 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2000-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 46375 b is 71.868 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 46375 b is 10.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 46375 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 46375, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 46375 - System With 1 Exoplanet
